Installing Panda3D in Linux

The easiest way to install panda is to use the RPM or DEB packages. This is only possible if your version of Linux is one of the provided versions of Linux. If not, you will need to compile from source <building-from-source>. If there is an installer available, download and install the RPM or DEB appropriate to your version of Linux.

After installing Panda, you should run the sample programs to verify that the installation is good. To do so, you need to change directory to the Panda samples directory, select a sample program, change directory to that sample, and run the sample using Python:
